definition: to read/to study/reading of word (i.e. pronunciation), similar to 拼音[pin1 yin1]

sentences.english: The world image turns to cause peoples mistakes of Wushu.
sentences.chinese: 世界圖像化導致了人們對武術的誤讀。

sentences.english: Are you perhaps just mis-reading the description?
sentences.chinese: 你也許只是誤讀的描述？

sentences.english: There are manifold reasons for the miswriting and mispronunciation of Chinese character.
sentences.chinese: 漢字的誤寫誤讀，原因是多方面的。

sentences.english: But that need for the dollar shouldn't be confused for American strength.
sentences.chinese: 但是，對美元的需求不應該被誤讀爲美國強大的象徵。

sentences.english: It is the author's hope that his research can help clarify the misinterpretations.
sentences.chinese: 這一研究有利於澄清當下的種種誤讀。

sentences.english: As a result of the cultural difference, the transliteration definitely will bring the misregistration.
sentences.chinese: 但是由於文化的差異，意譯必然會帶來誤讀。

sentences.english: This is actually a misinterpretation to Mcluhan's theories.
sentences.chinese: 這實際是對麥克盧漢的誤讀。

sentences.english: The animal kingdom's purposes have been terribly misunderstood here.
sentences.chinese: 動物王國的意義已被可怕的誤讀。

sentences.english: Most of the people why cry fair use are misreading the law.
sentences.chinese: 大部分人都會疑惑，爲什麼合理使用是誤讀法律？

sentences.english: Yet this argument depends upon a false reading of history.
sentences.chinese: 然而，這個爭論是建立在對歷史的誤讀之上的。

sentences.english: The fist part is about the research on probability of Zhao's misreading.
sentences.chinese: 文章第一個部分對造成趙孟頫誤讀的可能性進行探查。

sentences.english: As we come and go, such misunderstandings will be fewer and fewer.
sentences.chinese: 但是當人來人往之後，這樣的一種誤讀就會越來越少。

sentences.english: Misinterpretations of each other' s history leads to misinterpretations of each other's culture and values today.
sentences.chinese: 對彼此歷史的誤讀導致了文化和價值觀上的誤解。

sentences.english: In the case of design, the metaphor intentionally misrepresents the science so as to make a doctrinal point.
sentences.chinese: 就設計來說，這個比喻蓄意誤讀科學以取得教義效應。

sentences.english: The term presents in the western thoughts of deconstruction at first.
sentences.chinese: “誤讀”這一術語首先出現於西方解構主義思潮。

definition: pausing at the end of a phrase or sentence (in former times, before punctuation marks were used)/punctuation/periods and commas/sentences and phrases
to confuse one thing with another (idiom); to muddle
